argument.name: RTF_Text
argument.description: An ASCII encoded representation of the RTF text.

argument.name: data
argument.description: The contents of a RTF memo field.

page.discussion: The *BIN_TO_RTF() function converts binary RTF text to ASCII encoded RTF text. Limitations: Applies to Alpha Anywhere tables only.

section.title: Example
section.description: The following example reads RTF binary text, writes it to an HTML file, and displays it in a browser. Refer to *BIN_TO_HTML()for a picture of the original RTF memo field.
section.example: dim tbl as P dim rtftext as C tbl = table.open("customer") tbl.fetch_first() rtftext = *bin_to_rtf(tbl.rtfmemo) ? rtftext = "{\rtf1\ansi \deff0{\colortbl;\red0\green0\blue255;\red0\green0\blue0;\red255\green0\blue0;}{\fonttbl{\f0\fswiss Arial;}{\f1\fnil Verdana;}}{{\b \f1 \cf1 \fs20 Michael Baker}{\f1 \cf1 \fs20 }{\f1 \cf2 \fs20 lives at 14 Winman Street in}{\b \f1 \cf1 \fs20 }{\b \f1 \cf3 \fs20 Natick, Massachusetts}}}"
